required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autopsy Follow-up of Subjects Previously Imaged With Florbetapir F 18 (18F-AV-45) PET in Trial 18F-AV-45-A07
clinical_study.official_title: Autopsy Follow-up of Subjects Previously Imaged With Florbetapir F 18 (18F-AV-45) PET in Trial 18F-AV-45-A07

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to test the relationship between measurements of brain amyloid using florbetapir F 18 PET imaging and true levels of amyloid plaque density as measured by histopathological assessment. The study will address the following specific aims:
1. To expand the number of subjects included in the A07 (NCT00857415) trial correlation analysis (measuring the correlation between the global visual rating of brain amyloid plaque density on an independent blinded read of the florbetapir F 18 PET scan and the cortical amyloid plaque density at autopsy as assessed by histopathology for subjects in the autopsy cohort).
2. To determine the sensitivity and specificity of an independent blinded visual read assessment of the florbetapir F 18 PET scan (Aβ+ or Aβ-) versus the final blinded neuropathological assessment made at autopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Analysis in All Autopsy Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 24 months of florbetapir PET scan
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD (Consortium to Establish a Registry for AD) criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Specificity Analysis in All Autopsy Population
primary_outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 24 months of florbetapir PET scan
primary_outcome.description: Specificity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of Florbetapir-PET Image and Amyloid Plaque Density
primary_outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 24 months of florbetapir PET scan
primary_outcome.description: Spearman's rank order correlation of the median visual read of the florbetapir-PET image and the amyloid plaque density assessed post-mortem by quantitative immunohistochemistry (IHC) averaged across 6 brain regions (precuneus, parietal cortex, frontal cortex, temporal cortex, posterior cingulate, anterior cingulate). Spearman's rank order correlation ranges from -1 to +1. A value of -1 indicates perfect negative correlation, and a value of +1 indicates a perfect positive correlation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Analysis in Subjects With Autopsy Within 1 Year of Scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 12 months of florbetapir PET scan
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity Analysis in Subjects With Autopsy Within 1 Year of Scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 12 months of florbetapir PET scan
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).

intervention.description: No study drug administered in this trial. Study subjects previously dosed with 18F-AV-45 in study 18F-AV-45-A07 (NCT00857415) are followed to autopsy in this extension study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects are enrolled in this study if they:
- Met entrance criteria and were enrolled and imaged in trial 18F-AV-45-A07 (NCT00857415)
- Gave informed consent for the 18F-AV-45-A07 (NCT00857415) study procedures and brain donation consistent with the legal requirements of the State in which they are enrolled and the State in which they die
- Consent to participate in the 18F-AV-45-A16 (NCT01447719) extension protocol, if required by the IRB
- Reconfirm their consent to a research brain autopsy, if required by the IRB.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Demographic results are only provided for primary analysis populations of subjects who came to autopsy. Demographic characteristics for the entire population of 152 subjects are reported with the results of study A07 (NCT00857415).

group.title: Autopsy Cohort
group.description: End-of-life subjects consenting to brain donation at autopsy. Subjects received a single intravenous injection of 370 MBq florbetapir followed by a 10-minute PET scan 50 minutes post-injection.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Subject still living at end of study

group.title: All Autopsy Population
group.description: Group of subjects with valid images who came to autopsy within 2 years of scan

outcome.title: Sensitivity Analysis in All Autopsy Population
outcome.description: Sensitivity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD (Consortium to Establish a Registry for AD) criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).
outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 24 months of florbetapir PET scan
outcome.population: 39 of 59 subjects from all autopsy population had moderate to frequent neuritic plaques at autopsy

group.title: Subjects With Moderate or Frequent Plaques at Autopsy
group.description: Group of subjects with valid images who came to autopsy within 2 years of scan and had moderate to frequent neuritic plaques at autopsy (probable AD or definite AD)

measure.title: Sensitivity Analysis in All Autopsy Population
measure.description: Sensitivity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD (Consortium to Establish a Registry for AD) criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).
measure.population: 39 of 59 subjects from all autopsy population had moderate to frequent neuritic plaques at autopsy

analysis.groups_desc: Proportion of subjects who had a positive scan based on majority of 5 blinded readers
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CI calculated by Wilson score method

outcome.title: Specificity Analysis in All Autopsy Population
outcome.description: Specificity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).
outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 24 months of florbetapir PET scan
outcome.population: 20 of 59 subjects from the all autopsy population had no or sparse neuritic plaques at autopsy

group.title: Subjects With no or Sparse Plaques at Autopsy
group.description: Group of subjects with valid images who came to autopsy within 2 years of scan and had no or sparse neuritic plaques at autopsy (no AD or possible AD)

measure.title: Specificity Analysis in All Autopsy Population
measure.description: Specificity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).
measure.population: 20 of 59 subjects from the all autopsy population had no or sparse neuritic plaques at autopsy

analysis.groups_desc: Proportion of subjects who had a negative scan based on majority of 5 blinded readers
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CI calculated by Wilson score method

outcome.title: Correlation of Florbetapir-PET Image and Amyloid Plaque Density
outcome.description: Spearman's rank order correlation of the median visual read of the florbetapir-PET image and the amyloid plaque density assessed post-mortem by quantitative immunohistochemistry (IHC) averaged across 6 brain regions (precuneus, parietal cortex, frontal cortex, temporal cortex, posterior cingulate, anterior cingulate). Spearman's rank order correlation ranges from -1 to +1. A value of -1 indicates perfect negative correlation, and a value of +1 indicates a perfect positive correlation.
outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 24 months of florbetapir PET scan

group.title: All Autopsy Population
group.description: Group of subjects with valid images who came to autopsy within 2 years of scan

measure.title: Correlation of Florbetapir-PET Image and Amyloid Plaque Density
measure.description: Spearman's rank order correlation of the median visual read of the florbetapir-PET image and the amyloid plaque density assessed post-mortem by quantitative immunohistochemistry (IHC) averaged across 6 brain regions (precuneus, parietal cortex, frontal cortex, temporal cortex, posterior cingulate, anterior cingulate). Spearman's rank order correlation ranges from -1 to +1. A value of -1 indicates perfect negative correlation, and a value of +1 indicates a perfect positive correlation.

analysis.groups_desc: Spearman's Rank Order Correlation of the median semiquantitative read (three readers) and the quantitative IHC measurement of cortical amyloid plaque density averaged across six brain regions.
analysis.p_value_desc: A one-sided test (rho > 0) was performed with a significance level of alpha=0.05 to assess a significant correlation.
analysis.method_desc: Asymptotic standard error and 95 percent CI used Fisher z-transformation.

outcome.title: Sensitivity Analysis in Subjects With Autopsy Within 1 Year of Scan
outcome.description: Sensitivity of florbetapir-PET scan to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques. Plaque density was calculated using CERAD criteria. Florbetpir-PET scans were read by five independent readers blinded to clinical information using the binary read method (amyloid positive/negative).
outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 12 months of florbetapir PET scan
outcome.population: 28 of 46 subjects who died within 1 year of scan had moderate to frequent neuritic plaques at autopsy

outcome.description: Median sensitivity and specificity for 5 independent readers to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques (per CERAD criteria).

measure.title: Median Sensitivity and Specificity vs. CERAD Diagnosis
measure.description: Median sensitivity and specificity for 5 independent readers to detect moderate to frequent amyloid plaques (per CERAD criteria).

outcome.title: Individual Reader Results (All Scans With Autopsy)
outcome.description: Reader results (number of false negatives and number of false positives) for blinded independent readers. There were a total of 39 positive and 20 negative scans based on histopathology at autopsy.

group.title: All Autopsy Population
group.description: Group of subjects with valid images who came to autopsy within 2 years of scan

outcome.title: Individual Reader Results (Autopsy Within 1 Year of Scan)
outcome.description: Reader results (number of false negatives and number of false positives) for blinded independent readers. There were a total of 28 positive and 18 negative scans based on histopathology at autopsy.
outcome.time_frame: at autopsy within 12 months of florbetapir PET scan
outcome.population: Includes only those subjects with time from scan to autopsy less than one year.

reported_events.time_frame: No adverse events were collected in this study, as this study only followed study A07(NCT01447719) subjects to autopsy. Adverse events are reported with study A07 (NCT00857415).

group.title: Autopsy Cohort
group.description: End-of-life subjects consenting to brain donation at autopsy. Subjects received a single intravenous injection of 370 MBq florbetapir followed by a 10-minute PET scan 50 minutes post-injection.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
